1.name: Debit Party Derivation
1.description: The Local Office is derived as the Debit Party.

2.name: Debit Party Derivation
2.description: The related party is derived as the Debit Party

3.name: Debit Party Derivation
3.description: The payment goes to Repair with an error.

4.name: Credit Party Derivation
4.description: Try to find the owning customer by assessing the BIC

5.name: Credit Party Derivation
5.description: Try to find the owning customer (BIC) by assessing the NCC

6.name: Credit Party Derivation
6.description: The payment goes to Repair with an error.

7.name: Debit account derivation
7.description: Look for the Debit Party"s account in the original settlement currency If more than one account is found, select the preferred account. If multiple accounts were found but none of them is preferred - Repair Q.

8.name: Debit Account Derivation
8.description: Look for an account in GPP

9.name: Debit Account Derivation
9.description: Look for an account in GPP

10.name: Debit Account Derivation
10.description: The Debit Account is the Settlement Account in the Clearing

11.name: Debit Account Derivation
11.description: The Debit Account  is a suspense account relevant to the  source system

12.name: Debit account enrichment
12.description: Debit account is overridden or set as default

13.name: Debit Account Derivation
13.description: The payment goes to Repair with an error.

14.name: Credit Account Derivation
14.description: During the MOP selection phase the account will be defined as the settlement account in the clearing.

15.name: Credit Account Derivation
15.description: Look for the account GPP, and set it as the credit account

16.name: Credit Account Derivation
16.description: Look for the Credit Party"s account in the original settlement currency If more than one account is found, select the preferred account. If multiple accounts were found but none of them is preferred

17.name: Credit Account Derivation / Account Lookup
17.description: account lookup is performed, and the account sent in the response is set as the credit account (account quoted from payment)

18.name: Credit Account Derivation / Account Lookup
18.description: account lookup is performed,  GPP sends a request with account A , and receives a  response with account B. The account sent in the response is set as the credit account (account B)

19.name: Credit Account Derivation / Account Lookup
19.description: Credit account cannot be derived. The payment goes to Repair with an error. The user will manually set a Credit Account.

20.name: Credit Account Derivation / Account Lookup
20.description: Additional information can be sent from the host  system in to GPP via the account lookup response, that can be used by GPP processing

21.name: Credit Account Derivation
21.description: Payments go to Repair so that the user can decide which account should be inserted

22.name: Credit Account Derivation
22.description: Payments go to Repair so that the user can decide which account should be inserted

23.name: Credit account enrichment
23.description: Credit account is overridden or set as default

24.name: Account Maintenance (Static data)
24.description: GPP loads the account and selects it as the debit/credit account the one of the account attributes (that can be used for processing from here on) is the account type, as set up in the static data

25.name: Account Maintenance
25.description: The bank can use this information during payment processing.
